title: What is economic activity and how is it defined? - Quora

response.answer_text: Activities related to production , distribution , exchange & consumption of goods & services are called Economic Activities. All the transactions that takes place in terms of money or can be calculated in terms of money are economic activities. For example if you went to a shop & purchased a Nutella for you then this is an economic activity as you paid the price or the money in exchange for the commodity that you have purchased. But when your mother cooks the food at home & you eat it. you don't pay anything in return to her as she will never demand for it hence this is a non-economic activity or transaction. There are three types of Economic Activities- Profession- these economic activities are incurred by professionals like Doctors , Lawyers, Chartered Accountants etc. They provide their services to their clients or people as they have a special knowledge about a particular subject. So they charge in return to their services. The amount that they charge is called fees.Employment- these economic activities are incurred by the people who do a job under a particular firm or a person. They do not have special knowledge about a particular subject or have a license to do it. They are also paid in return for their services known as salary. A person who does the job is called employee & who provide the job is called employer.Business- these are the economic activities that are related to the production of goods & services. This activity is done with the aim of earning profit. Any activity which is directly or in directly related to the production of goods & services is business. For example advertising , manufacturing , warehousing , distribution etc.

It depends. “Economic activity” in strictest sense is any activity that creates measurable value (i.e. is remunerated). In other words, anything you do for money or anything you pay money for. The sum of everything that is done with this activity in a country in a year (all the value added), is the Gross Domestic Product. It can be measured in many ways, none of which match each other perfectly. Keeps statisticians busy. “Economic activity” in a statistician’s (or a bureaucrat’s) language is a way to classify those activities by nature, to tax and measure them accordingly. Without classification there is no analysis… “Economic activity” in a taxman’s language usually means any regular activity that produces income. Getting paid to mow your uncle’s lawn or write a single blog post or teach a single karate masterclass is not economic activity. Doing it more than occassionally is. Ubering, in any shape, is beginning to be recognized as economic activity (as it is). If you work at something that does not generate objectively measurable value (as in, it does not generate a wage or price for someone) it is not an economic activity. Painting a masterpiece that never gets sold nor accounted for, is not economic activity. Developing the world’s best artificial intelligence algorithm for free (in your off-hours) is not economic activity. “Economic activity” in a wider sense refers to the “robustness” of an economy or the frequency of economic transactions, not so much the volume (GDP) as the intensity of transactions relative to that volume. If the money supply is stable (not now), the money velocity is almost a reasonable indicator of the way activity is going. “Economic activity rate” is the part of the population that wants to work (people in the market for a job).
